metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6003 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the _asn1_decode_simple_ber function in decoding.c in GNU Libtasn1 before 4.13. Unlimited recursion in the BER decoder leads to stack exhaustion and DoS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6003` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtasn1-3-bin - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libtasn1-6 - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libtasn1-bin - 4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> libtasn1-3 (precise) and libtasn1-6 (trusty) are not affected since vulnerable code was introduced in 4.3 bionic already has the fix

criterions.comment: libtasn1-6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.7-3ubuntu0.16.04.3').
